Entail.origin: [Middle English entaillen , from en -, causative prefix + taille restriction on inheritance see tail ]

1.definition: an act or instance of entailing real propertythe practice of entailing property [the repeal of the laws of would prevent the accumulation and perpetuation of wealth in select families "Thomas Jefferson"] see alsoin the Important Laws section

2.definition: an entailed estate in real property [ifhad not become barrable "Eileen Spring"]

3.definition: the fixed line of descent of an entailed estate
